Wrong clicks take away six seconds from the clock. The timer can be turned off at the main menu.
One of three mini-games appears after each level: a concentration game with cards, a Simon game with orbs and a Master Mind lock-picking game. Some of these games can be played over again to get extra hints. The hint button highlights the position of one of the objects.
Game.Title: Nocturnal: Boston Nightfall

Game.Notes:
Choose from nine characters and start your career as a Snake Master in Snake Warriors: Training. Show your talent as a driver at the race tracks in Snake Race and demonstrate your patience and skill in avoiding hitting your own body in Classic Training. But are you sure you can also do this in the dark in Night Training?
If you possess all these skills, then show you have an excellent memory in the Snake Memory game, but beware: in some levels you will even need to combine all your talents with numerical skills. If you turn out to be good at all these games and you have also mastered picking up moving items in Hunting Targets, you will be heading for a successful career in which you can unlock many pieces of clothing for your snake as well as medals throughout the 75 levels.
Specifications: - 75 levels - 5 games - 9 characters - 3 save slots
Game.Title: Snake Warriors: Training

Game.Notes:
Enter the World Ping Pong Championship to compete against the worldâs best to become the ultimate champion in this exciting arcade game. A tournament based games where you compete against 5 other countries for the championâs trophy. Play in practice mode to horn your skills against individual countries and then enter the world tournament to prove your might. Choose among various strike tactics and paddles to win over your opponent. Aim for the gold trophy in a simulated real world experience. Play music as per your mood and watch it translate to great scores on the Game Center.
â¢ Intuitive key controls help you place the ball more accurately on the table. â¢ The game offers two different player modes - Practice mode and Tournament mode â¢ Three unique paddle styles to play with. â¢ Choose your favorite paddle each with its own physics and game play.
Game.Title: World Ping Pong Championship

Game.Notes:
Where is My Heart? is a 2D puzzle platformer about three forest spirits (coloured brown, orange and black) who are lost in the forest. The player has to help them piece back together the environment so they can get home to the tree where they live. The game consists of 26 single screen levels. They are completed when the three spirits reach the magical tree.
The three spirits always appear at the start of the level and are controlled separately by switching between them. They are all able to move around and jump. They can stand on top of each other to reach platforms and buttons can make blocks and platforms appear in the environment. In specific locations they can form a tower of three spirits and the one at the top then transforms into a magical creature with a specific ability. The brown spirit becomes Antler Ancestor who can double jump. The orange spirit becomes Rainbow Spirit and can rotate the world. The black spirit becomes Bat King and is able to illuminate the environment to reveal platforms only visible to it.
The most prominent puzzle element of the game is that the level is split up in several comic-book panels. These form a single environment, but are often not in the right order and all over the screen. Even though they are apart, the logical sequence of the panels is maintained, meaning that if a character exists a panel to the right, it will appear in the next panel following the logical order, regardless of the position of the panel on the screen. The most difficult puzzles are used in conjunction with the orange spirit's ability to rotate the world. The character can jump, freeze in the air and then rotate the world to continue in another panel, even if that would be logically impossible. If the character is released outside of a panel or if any character falls down a gap, it dies immediately but restarts from the beginning.
Next to merely completing a level, it is possible to finish it in a better way by collecting all hearts along the way. There is also a perfect way to complete a level by collecting all hearts without dying once. Levels are unlocked one after another, but by perfecting them it is possible to reveal some earlier.
Game.Title: Where Is My Heart?

Game.Notes: Kaleidoscope consists of level-paintings, which differ in style and behavior, yet are controlled in a similar fashion with the help of just four buttons. The simplicity of the controls is overcompensated by the rich audio/visual experience presented within the game. Playerâs responses to a constantly changing environment shall have an impact on both image and audio. This creates an illusion of a player being simultaneously a painter of the current image and a composer of the music heard. In addition to that, each level in Kaleidoscope has a clear defined goal, which opens up doors of an infinite synaesthesia world to the masses.
Game.Title: Kaleidoscope: Interactive Synaesthesia Project

Game.Notes:
Thousands of meteors are heading towards earth! Are you ready to take the hero's seat in this mesmerizing arcade game?
Are you ready to take the hero's seat in this mesmerizing arcade game? We hope so. Civilization is threatened by a terrifying, multi-phased meteor attackâthousands of strange meteors are heading towards Earth! Your mission is to protect our cities by controlling a rocket launcher that is built to protect each city.
Features
â¢ Waves of increasingly destructive meteors
â¢ Innovative power ups
â¢ Over 100 exciting levels
Game.Title: Rocks N' Rockets

Game.Notes:
Have you ever sat around with your mates discussing the strengths and weaknesses of the 4-4-2 diamond formation? Ever sung (or at least thought) âYou donât know what youâre doing!â as your teamâs manager hauls off a favourite player? Think you could do better?
If the answerâs yes, maybe itâs time you took your place in the dugout and tried your hand at This is Football Managementâ¢ â the footie management sim, available exclusively on PSPâ¢ and PS3â¢.
Take your favourite English football team â from any of the top four divisions â and manage your way to eternal glory by winning trophies and claiming league titles. Based on the 2009-10 season with realistic player ratings and data, this is your opportunity to manage a squad of up to 30 players, handle player transfers, deal with injuries, choose tactics and ultimately send out a winning team on that all-important Saturday afternoon.
Easy to pick up and enjoy, This is Football Managementâ¢ features a comprehensive âEdit Modeâ allowing you to customise proceedings and play how you want to play. And the 2D match engine simulates games, so you can follow each fixture, cheering as the goals go in and making substitutions and tactical decisions as you see fit.
So what are you waiting for? Start your managerial career today: forget about the Special One, itâs time for you to become the biggest gaffer in the game!
Game.Title: This is Football Management

Game.Notes:
As the name implies, Let's Golf! is a handheld-golf-game. The game features four fictitious golf courses in Fiji, England, USA and Scotland. The goal is of course to get the ball into the hole with the flag in as less strikes as possible. To make it harder for the players to meet that goal, the courses are littered with obstacles like hills and sand bunkers. In addition the wind decides too where the player's ball lands.
As opposed to real life though, the player can influence the ball's flightpath during the flight by choosing in which direction it spins. This allows to compensate for wind and also for a bad angle at the strike. How hard the player hits the ball is decided by a gauge where the player needs to click at the right moment. The same goes for the angle. Although the game hands the player a club that it thinks fits the situation, he can also choose his own.
Game.Title: Let's Golf

Game.Notes: Zombie Tycoon differs from most zombie games in the fact that the player is able to control and customize three squads of zombies rather than fighting them off. The game is not a tycoon game as the title suggests, with gameplay closer to being a real-time strategy game.
Game.Title: Zombie Tycoon

Game.Notes: A monstrous assault is taking place on your PSPÂ® system and it's up to you, the tank commander, to wipe out the relentless invading enemy forces. You must stay on deadly alert as these armies are devious and will change up their attack style to overpower you. Deploy all types of weapons and seize power ups in a crusade to save your base before your energy and your funding run out!
Game.Title: Charge! Tank Squad

Game.Notes:
Arcade Air Hockey & Bowlingâ¢ offers fully featured 3D versions of Air Hockey & Bowling, with smooth analogue control and realistic gameplay. Win trophies and unlock new equipment in the World Tour career mode, or challenge a friend to play.
- 2-player multiplayer - play with friends and family in versus play modes
- Varied game modes - including Practice, Versus, Custom Tournament and Season
- Season mode - become the World Ranked No.1 player; winning extra player rewards including new equipment and special trophies
- Sophisticated AI - opponent AI designed to play a realistic 'human' game, from amateur level through to top ranking
Game.Title: Arcade Air Hockey & Bowling

Game.Notes:
Golf Mania features over 90 holes of golfing mayhem that is easy to learn but tough to master.
With single and multiplayer gaming on classic grass courses and modern courses built upon incredible gravity defying glass towers, Golf Mania offers hours of gameplay for the whole family.
Game.Title: Golf Mania

Game.Notes: Download the magnificent coral reefs of the deep blue to your console. Feel the atmosphere of the underwater world and watch its inhabitants swimming around you. You will see the most vivid ocean fishes there. Fish library will help you to find out more about these amazing creatures. And do not forget to feed fish and play with them â fish are very easy to get upset.
Game.Title: Reef Aquarium

Game.Notes: Pilot a spaceship, collect various speed and weapon items to take down a multitude of enemies, and restore peace to the galaxy in this vertical scrolling shooter released by SNK in 1989.
Game.Title: The Next Space

Game.Notes: The evil Big-Wig has covered the characters town in crummy marketing gibberish. It's up to you to control three rebellious characters through 50+ levels of headache inducing puzzles in Revoltin' Youth, a puzzle/platformer game featuring a unique pixel-art style and a robust soundtrack.
Game.Title: Revoltin' Youth

Game.Notes:
The goal of the game is to move the alien to its destination. The alien is trapped in an array of cubes. The player can move the alien and the cubes. The alien can be moved in all four directions based on empty spaces available around him. Cubes can be moved only in the directions indicated by the arrow marks on the cubes. So the player has to move the alien and the cubes wisely to make path for the alien to collect the spare parts and other interesting elements in the world.
Features â¢ Three difficulty mode (Easy, Medium & Hard) â¢ 40 levels in each mode â¢ Totally 120 levels
Game.Title: D-Cube Planet

Game.Notes:
DuÃ¦l Invaders is a deliciously retro single-screen shootemup that lets you take control of two ships at once on the same PSPÂ® (PlayStationÂ®Portable) system or DUALSHOCKÂ®3 wireless controller
In the depths of deep space a human colony is threatened by the DuÃ¦l Invaders; the reddest and bluest badguys ever to threaten a human colony.
Using only the power of your red and blue player ships, a few power ups, and a simple-yet-innovative Aggro system called âSkewâ, you must take on wave-after-wave of deadly enemies.
You score more points for shooting enemies of the same colour, but this also makes them VERY ANGRY! This simple rule is the key to staying alive and racking up massive high scores.
Throw in cool Dual (Co-op) and Duel (Versus) multiplayer modes that get your buddies involved and youâve got an awesome retro-shmup with the weirdest name on the Store! Good luck out there Commander!
Game.Title: Duael Invaders

Game.Notes:
Shapo is a challenge that will keep you on the edge!
Shapo is a challenge that will keep you on the edge! Balance the scales as you place shapes made of different materials. Play more than 150 levels in Classic or Puzzle mode to unlock the greatest wonders of the world. Stunning art brings 15 wonders of the world to life! Enjoy exciting power ups such as the material bomb and line bomb. Each ball and shape has a different weight so be careful when placing your pieces!
*Classic Mode: Create lines to remove balls. Match sequential lines and watch the combo multiplier grow!
*Puzzle Mode: Complete increasingly complicated levels by filling the grid with the given balls.
Game.Title: Shapo

Game.Notes: BounceBack is an exciting 2D Platform/Puzzle game about a bouncy ball called Lanos who over time has lost his bounce! Control Lanos on a quest to get his bounce back, solving puzzles and overcoming obstacles in 28 thought-provoking levels. Journey higher and higher through several progressively challenging areas to get Lanos back to his home world on the moon! Collect the magical Bounceables in order to fill up your BounceBar and get some serious air! Along the way befriend a host of memorable support characters to aid in puzzle solving, each with unique special abilities at your disposal. Do you have what it takes to bounce all the way to the stars? Don your thinking cap and download this puzzle-fuelled title now!
Game.Title: BounceBack

Game.Notes:
Sky Force is a vertically scrolling shoot 'em up video game series created by the Polish video game developer Infinite Dreams Inc.. The gameplay is reminiscent of Capcom's 19XX series and Seibu Kaihatsu's Raiden series, featuring a weapon upgrade system and large end of stage bosses.
Sky Force Reloaded:
The second outing was initially released for Symbian, Pocket PC and Palm webOS in 2006 and was later released for iOS (2009), Iphone ios 7 (2010) and PSP (2011). The PSP version of "Sky Force Reloaded" was simply named "Sky Force". The 2D graphics style of the first title was combined with some 3D polygon objects like destructible towers. It received a remake for mobile in 2016, with a PC, PlayStation 4, and Xbox One versions released in 2017, and also a Nintendo Switch version released in 2018.
Game.Title: Sky Force

Game.Notes: Basha Baloot brings the popular trick-taking card game to the minis platform. Partner up with the game AI and play against the rival team in this game of wit and strategy. The game puts the player in an atmosphere of playing with old friends, with rich arabesque visuals that stem from traditional game boards and tables from the Arabian region. The realistic gameplay is further enhanced by a relaxing soundtrack, and all in all provides for hours of endless fun!
Game.Title: Basha Baloot

Game.Notes:
Carnivores: Ice Age is third game in the hunting series. This version is set on the Arctic regions of planet FMM UV-32. Scientists of DinoHunt Corp. discovered that animals from the Ice Age still live there and they establish a hunting program. There are no missions in the game. The player selects what to hunt and then roams the planet using a mini-map, a compass and an assortment of guns to hunt down the animals.
In the PS3/PSP mini version the killing animations are toned down and corpses disappear instead of being picked up by a dropship.
Game.Title: Carnivores: Ice Age

Game.Notes:
After several years researching fun, Dr. has found the perfect formula and has given it its name: Dr. MiniGames. This brilliant formula is available for you to put to the test.
Enjoy this new game concept that brings together a large variety of mini-games that last just a few seconds and are fast, frantic. . . AND FUN!!!
Prepare yourself to cross a field of pumpkins at the speed of light, without crashing into any of them, or go through the fair and throw the monkey into the pool. You'll also need to rely on your reflexes to avoid the spacecraft from landing on your head, or giant corn worms from swallowing you.
With Dr. MiniGames you can choose the degree of difficulty to master each of the mini-games and remember... you only have 4 seconds to demonstrate your skills!
Game.Title: Dr. Minigames

Game.Notes:
Top Gun is a free-flying air combat shooter based on the film. In Top Gun, players enroll in the Top Gun Academy as Maverick with their Radio Information Officer Goose to go up against the best for Top Gun honors. Following graduation, players fly into the danger zone with fellow US Navy pilots over the Indian Ocean, where they shoot down enemy fighter jets, defend and attack bases and engage in large-scale dogfight battles.
Top Gun features 7 gameplay modes, 2 single and 5 multiplayer. In Campaign Mode, players first learn the ropes at the academy and progress to active duty, teaming up with seasoned flyers to take down enemy jets over the Indian Ocean. In Horde Mode, players show off their flying prowess as they defeat endless waves of increasingly challenging enemies. In online multiplayer, players enlist in the Navy or join their comrades to go head-to-head with up to 15 other opponents in 5 different modes: Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Top Gun, Bombing Run and Capture the Flag.
Game.Title: Top Gun

Game.Notes: Find yourself behind the wheels of off-road vehicles in 4x4 JAM. Jump over your opponent or roll down a steep hill. No rules, no boundaries, racing is sheer fun.
Game.Title: 4x4 Jam

Game.Notes: Take control of Newton, the flying hamster in this action-frenzy horizontal shooter. You will fly across six unique environments, from the sunflower fields to the big Japanese city or the crazy ancient Egypt. Eight freaky weapons are scattered among the levels, and you'll need them all to take on the more than 35 different enemies (sneaky penguins, anti-air cows, exploding foxes, ninja squirrels, toaster-robots...) as well as the six dreadful and unpredictable bosses.
Game.Title: The Flying Hamster

Game.Notes:
Out beyond, in the galaxy of Tetrenova, a war has been fought that has exhausted resources and even worlds. The survivors band together and look for a new place to rebuild. They choose a seemingly undeveloped planet, Earth.
Using your defense ship 'Syd,' you must destroy the invading forces and ground targets with bombs. Obtain power-ups to gain energy for ship upgrades that allow you to transform to a more powerful machine. The game itself is a vertical shooter, moving continuously up towards the top of the screen.
Game.Title: Alpha Mission

Game.Notes:
Various remakes of Speedball 2 have been released. Speedball 2100, released only for the PlayStation, is a 3D version of Speedball 2 with more options such as choosing and renaming any team, instead of having to play with Brutal Deluxe. This version, released in September 2000, failed to win over gamers and press because it lacked the speed and gameplay of the originals.[citation needed]
Empire Interactive released Speedball 2: Brutal Deluxe onto Xbox Live Arcade on October 17, 2007.[14] The game features a 3D graphics mode in addition to the "classic" visuals, as well as additional teams and online play.[15] According to statements by the Bitmap Brothers, this version of the game takes place in the 24th century. It was eventually delisted from Xbox Live Arcade, but people who have already downloaded it are still able to play it.
Frogster Interactive Pictures released a remake developed by Kylotonn, Speedball 2 Tournament onto Steam in November 2007.[16] In February 2011, Tower Studios released another updated version called Speedball 2: Evolution, developed by Vivid Games for iOS. The game features multiplayer support and achievements via Game Center.[17] It was also released for the PlayStation Portable and PlayStation 3.
A remake for the PC titled Speedball 2 HD was released December 5, 2013 on Steam. It's developed by Vivid Games and directed by Jon Hare.[18]
Game.Title: Speedball 2: Evolution

Game.Notes: The Ice Road Truckers is a racing game that captures the spirit and danger of the series by putting players in the driver's seat of an eighteen wheeler. Players face a number of challenges as they haul equipment and supplies to isolated outposts north of the Arctic Circle. Player take command of these huge 18-wheelers and drive their way across ice roads. Stay on the road, avoid obstacles, and reach the destination before time runs out. Quicker times earn you more money, but if you're late you won't advance !
Game.Title: History: Ice Road Truckers

Game.Notes:
In Alien Zombie Death, players take on the role of the Spaceman who is working all alone on mining platforms, and who is constantly under siege by Alien Zombies..
The game consists of fourteen levels (seven planets each with their own moon). Each level consists of multiple platforms that can be jumped up to or dropped down on. The player moves between these platforms while dodging environmental hazards and firing on the various aliens that constantly spawn in the level. Each level has several medals that can be earned for completing various tasks such as collecting a set number of coins or shooting a specific number of a certain type of alien. These medals are used to open up the later levels which are locked at the start.
Players can also find temporary weapon upgrades for the standard laser gun such as the 3-Way beam and Laser Missile scattered around the levels. Also, the Spaceman can only take three hits before the game ends, however a health item will occasionally appear which restores a hit when collected. Being that the enemies never stop coming till the Spaceman dies, other than collecting medals, the other goal of the game is to get as high of a score as possible for each level.
Game.Title: Alien Zombie Death

Game.Notes: Yo! I got a "job" for you, if you know what I mean. The Godfather needs a favor for the Mafia. I need you to drive a getaway car, collect cash, and outrun some cops thatâll be chasing you. Race through the city as fast as you can and find some loot that some of my boys left hanging around. The cops are onto us so youâre gunna have some heat on you. I mean a LOT of heat. But donât worry, my cousin Johnny left some oil cans and a few other 'tings laying around for youse to use. Just remember, your getaway car is always in motion so make sure the cops don't get you cornered! Got it! Now get 'otta here!
Game.Title: Crime Spree

Game.Notes: Play as Colonel Ralf, manuevering your tank and firing its machine guns and cannon. Destroy the enemy army in this arcade classic originally released in 1985, featuring revolutionary controls for its time!
Game.Title: T.N.K. III

Game.Notes: Beam'em Up is a downloadable action/puzzle game for PSP in which the player is cast in the role of a space scientist, piloting a spaceship with the goal of acquiring and collecting alien specimens from various planets and environments. Thanks to lush environments styled in 1950s sci-fi visuals, an accurate 2D physics system, addictive puzzle gameplay, and collection mechanics, Beat'em Up is homage to the classic era of videogames, revisited with contemporary look and feel.
Game.Title: Beam'em Up

Game.Notes:
The first in a line of pinball games from 21st Century and Digital Illusions, with four tables covering themes such as the wild west for Steel Wheel, space rockets for Ignition, a haunted graveyard for Nightmare and pop music for Beat Box.
The portable versions for the Game Boy and Game Gear only have 3 of the 4 original tables with the removal of Beat Box.
The iPhone version includes updated graphics (optional) and gameplay in both portrait and landscape orientation.
Game.Title: Pinball Dreams Minis

Game.Notes: Welcome to Zombhai, a city populated by zombies! What will it take you to survive? Featuring a wide range of weapons and locations this game will bring hours of fun.
Game.Title: Left to Die in Zombhai

Game.Notes: You have been convicted of a crime you didn't mean to commit. Your sentence was harsh despite the circumstances, and now you rot in jail. But those affected by your actions are not satisfied. Now, they are threatening to kill the one you love to exact revenge. And if you do not escape and reach the courthouse in 24 hours, she'll be gone. There are no other options. You must run.
Game.Title: I Must Run

Game.Notes: Join Athena, Princess of the Kingdom of Victory as she opens the "Forbidden Door" and descends into a world of fantasy in this classic platform arcade game originally released in 1986.
Game.Title: Athena

Game.Notes:
Ambassador Kane is a platform/puzzle game in a 2.5D view. It is your job as chief of security to make sure the ambassador survives his perilous journey through the galaxy!
Create a safe path for the ambassador so that he can reach and hack terminals to open the exit door on each level. Use the two different construction robots - the stair robot and the teleporter robot - to build a path. But be aware of enemies and laser fences that will have a fatal impact on Kane and your construction units if you don't pay attention. Pull out your sniper rifle which you can use to eliminate threats.
Improve your high score by collecting stars and documents â you'll earn stars by completing each level under a given time and you'll find documents throughout the levels. Collect them all to unlock the 20 insanely difficult bonus levels, a special surprise, and an alternate ending!
Game.Title: Ambassador Kane

Game.Notes:
Defenders of the Mystic Garden is a play on the popular Tower Defense genre of games. Players will find that various animals and insects are wreaking havoc on our backyard garden gnomes and stealing their strawberries. Itâs up to you to place and command your defenses. Instead of static towers you place one of four unit types. These units can also be moved or set to patrol between two points.
12 challenging levels of play spread out over 4 unit themed environments.
4 Playable Tower Units, each with differing strategies, each with unique voice-overs and SFX during in-game events. They are the Warrior, Ranger, Fire Mage and Ice Mage.
16 challenges for added re-playability with progress tracking (examples: defeating a certain number of enemies with patrolling units, clearing a level with no strawberries being taken, and different ways to clear a level).
16 enemies to defeat, collect, and study.
Can you keep all the strawberries?
Game.Title: Defenders of the Mystic Garden

Game.Notes: Play 8 ball US, 9 ball US and 8 ball UK rules, one player, two player, Time Trial (against the clock) and Shot in the Dark modes all drawn by a doodle, it's fun, casual and seriously addictive! Already a major hit Doodle Pool is destined to be a future classic, quick bite sized gaming but maddingly addictive enough to keep you at it for hours.
Game.Title: Doodle Pool

Game.Notes:
Pac-Man: Championship Edition is a sequel, by the same developer TÅru Iwatani, done in the style of the original classic. As before, you are Pac-Man and you are in a maze with dots, power pellets and hosts. The object is to eat the dots and avoid the ghosts, unless you eat a power pellet, which gives you the ability to eat the ghosts for a few seconds.
What's new here is many different mazes and modes. This is designed from the ground up as a console game, so some arcade traditions are lost. The object is no longer to try to survive/get a high score without losing quarters, but to get a high score in a set time limit. You do still have a set number of lives, which makes your time end early if you lose all them.
Unlike the original or its prodigy, Championship Edition isn't broken into distinct levels. Once you clear one side of the maze, a fruit appears on the other side. Eating the fruit regenerates the empty half with new walls, dots, power pellets, etc and increases the game speed.
The iPhone version of the game adds two additional modes. In "Mission Mode", you must clear a specific goal set by the game at the beginning of play (such as eating two apples, or eating eight ghosts consecutively). In "Challenge Mode", you must aim to achieve the top score for each course, but this time the ghosts have been sped up so that they are initially much faster.
The look is a bright neon which evokes the classic Pac-Man but takes advantage of nearly 30 years of increased computer power.
Game.Title: Pac-Man: Championship Edition

Game.Notes:
MiniSquadron is a side scrolling shooter where the player takes control of a tiny little plane in dogfights against wave after wave of other similar little planes. Gameplay is similar to games like Sopwith and Triplane Turmoil. The player can move freely around in all directions and do various aerobatic manoeuvres such as loops, turns and rolls. In addition to shooting at the enemy planes the player also has avoid crashing. Fly to high and the plane begins to stall and to avoid crashing into the ground the player needs to turn around the nose and dive to regain control. The player can pick up various power ups that fall from the sky. These include extra health, increased speed and various special attacks such as airstrikes and very large laser beams.
The game consists of eight levels each with twelve waves of enemy attacks. At the start the player only has one simple plane available put a further 55 can be unlocked through out the game. Each plane not only has its own look but differs in characteristics. Some planes are quick but weak while others might be bigger in size and have different weaponry. The player will come across many different enemies from simple planes similar to his own to animals and UFO's. Most are in the air but there are also some ground targets that need to be taken down.
In addition to the wave after wave mode called classic there is also a survival mode and a multiplayer mode. Survival is a mode without an end. The player simple has to stay alive as long possible. The multiplayer is for two players and is played over a wi-fi network.
Game.Title: MiniSquadron

Game.Notes: Apache Overkill is a side-scrolling pixel/retro style shooter that originated as a Flash game on the web and was upgraded and enhanced for the iOS and PSN versions. The player controls an Apache attack helicopter through four different levels but the objectives remain the same, simply destroy everything in the helicopter's path in the air and on the ground and pick up all the health, weapons and ammo that drop down from the top of the screen.
Game.Title: Apache Overkill

Game.Notes:
Can you correctly identify a duck by only looking at a zoomed in picture of its bill? How about spotting an rhino by just by a flashing image of its rump? Quiz Animania is a lighthearted game that will challenge your knowledge of the animal kingdom. Animal lovers will have their wits tested as they race to identify animals before time runs out. For big bonuses look for chance questions that could be your shot to earn loads of points and come back from behind to beat your friends. Play solo in the certification mode or head-to-head with a friend. Good Luck!
Recommended for two players and playable using a single PSPÂ® system.
Game.Title: Quiz Animania

Game.Notes: The hit web game puzzle franchise comes home in Mad Blocker Alpha. Mad Blocker is a traditional puzzler based around the lining up of 4 or more blocks of the same color. The game is fairly straight forward but itâs the hand drawn visuals and ease of play that are the games main attraction. See how many Fluzzles you can save!!
Game.Title: Mad Blocker Alpha: Revenge of the Fluzzles

Game.Notes: Face off against the computer or a friend in the crazy frenetic world of double sided Pinball Duel. With two balls being catapulted around the pinball arena, nail the timing and use your flippers to smack them at just the right angle. Tag the bonus target marks to win big prizes, unleash more balls and work to reach the coveted 10,000 point mark. Trying to catch up, but running out of luck, be devious and tilt the board to gain an advantage!
Game.Title: Pinball Duel

Game.ApplicationPath: ..\roms\pspminis\Fighting Fantasy - The Warlock of Firetop Mountain.cso
Game.Notes: Fighting Fantasy: The Warlock of Firetop Mountain is a first person shooter action RPG for the Nintendo DS developed by Big Blue Bubble and published by Aspyr in North America on November 25, 2009. The game is loosely based on the roleplaying gamebook of the same name.
Game.Title: Fighting Fantasy: The Warlock of Firetop Mountain
Game.Version: Fighting Fantasy - The Warlock of Firetop Mountain

Game.Notes:
Fortix is a Qix variant with a medieval fantasy theme. The game takes places in the land of Fortiana where the reign of evil forces have turned the place into a desolate wasteland. The player takes control of the heir of the late king, Knight Fortix in his attempt to reclaim the land from the dark ruler.
The kingdom consists of twelve shires, each a level in the game. Each level has one or several enemy buildings and the goal is to conquer all of them. As in Qix the player can move around the borders of the playfield safely. By moving inwards and leaving the base line the player draws lines. This makes him vulnerable towards the enemies. By connecting his line with the base line the player can conquer land. Any enemy that is encircled will be killed. The monsters of Fortix are different kinds of dragons with different capabilities. The player also has to watch out for towers that shoot pellets whenever the player leaves the base line. These can be taken out with the use of catapults. These are triggered when the player encircles an halberd icon. There is one catapult for each tower on the map. Towers can also be taken out by conquering the land they are on.
There is different kinds of terrain in the game which impacts the movement speed of the player. Walking on grass is fast while water and swamps are slower to traverse. There is also walls that the player can't move through and has to find a way around. The player will find power ups scattered around the levels which he can pick up by encircling them. These can do many things from increasing the player's speed to freezing the monsters for a short time.
Game.Title: Fortix

Game.Notes:
Screeching tires, the smell of burned rubber, the rush of adrenaline and enemies that are left in the dust-these are the emotions that drive real racers. However there is much more than this in the world of Monochrome Racing-there is the passion for color! Color is everything here, it is what you strive for, in the world where everything is in black and white. Color is your fuel, color gives you speed, color makes you stronger and ultimately makes you the true leader of the monochrome racing world.
- More than 80 tracks to complete - More than 10 cars to choose from and upgrade - Numerous power ups and bonuses that makes your vehicle stronger and your enemies weaker - Mysterious monochrome world to immerse
Game.Title: Monochrome Racing

Game.Notes: This game is a unique mixture of action, RPG and simulator. Player finds himself in the world, where the air is ruled by hovering vehicles â one of which he takes under control. According to a plot, player have to fight his way through the numerous combats with monsters and accomplish different missions. During the headway to the the heart of the fairy kingdom , playerâs hovering vehicle gets new weapon, armor and other useful power-ups.
Game.Title: Age of Hammer Wars

Game.Notes: Thundering into the unknown at breakneck speed, are you agile enough to negotiate the perils of Trailblazer? Roll left and right to avoid the cracks and be careful not to fall off the edge of the path as you go. Be sure to identify and avoid the special tiles which will speed you up and slow you down, block your path or make you jump automatically. Determination, speed and dexterity are the key assets needed to complete Trailblazer successfully.
Game.Title: Trailblazer

Game.Notes:
Brick Breaker is a Breakout variant consisting of a Classic Mode and a Dual Paddle Mode.
The Classic Mode contains fifty different levels to play through. Players bounce a ball off a paddle trying to get the ball to destroy all the bricks on a level. Sometimes a destroyed brick will drop a power-up. Power-ups include things such as a rocket launcher, glue that stick the ball to the paddle, multi-balls, and hearts that give the player an extra life.
The Dual Paddle Mode consists of twelve levels and features similar gameplay of the Classic Mode. The only difference is now the player controls two paddles (one at the top of the screen, the other at the bottom) that mirror each others movements,
Game.Title: Brick Breaker

Game.Notes:
Use your laser to cut away the surfaces of a mysterious cube and free the energy within. Cutting longer lines and crossing multiple cube surfaces gives you bigger combos, but at far greater risk.
Can you brave this hazardous environment and complete all 20 levels? Old-school, highscore-chasing gameplay with a modern twist.
Do you have what it takes to top the high score table and become number one?
Game.Title: Cubixx

Game.Notes: Challenge 192 athletes from eight countries, in nine sporting events such as discus throw, high jump, boxing, and swimming to become the Gold Medalist at the 1988 Seoul Olympics! Can you defeat Louis or Ben?
Game.Title: Gold Medalist

Game.Notes: Your legendary sky-pirate crew may have been responsible for unleashing an apocalyptic curse of giant insects upon the world â and now thereâs only 24 hours to save their necks from the hangmanâs nooseâ¦ Despite protestations that âdangerously cursed islandsâ should REALLY be more clearly sign-posted, First Mate Rana sets out to smash her way through the relentless scuttling horde in a sword-swinging arcade battler set against an epic backdrop of sky-islands and piracy! Can YOU survive against overwhelming odds? Deploy combo attacks and running swipes, blocks and dodges, then use DEVASTATING special moves to turn the tables on the SWARM and send the bugs spiraling into the clouds. Just make sure you keep solid ground beneath your own feet at the same timeâ¦ Join Rana, Captain Bluebell and Mr Yoho as they deal outsky-pirate justice! Make barely coherent plans! Enjoy celebratory fruit cocktails â¦ and BREAK the curse of 1000 TINY CLAWS!
Game.Title: 1000 Tiny Claws

Game.Notes: TETRISâ iconic blocky shapes are just as effective at occupying every spare thought when youâre not playing as they were when they debuted in 1984. As the times have changed, so too has TETRIS itself, becoming more visually striking while retaining that classic infectious gameplay.
Game.Title: Tetris

Game.Notes:
HISTORY Egypt Engineering Empire allows players to build their own empire from its foundations to the height of its power. Acting as the leader of a territory from the Egyptian Empire, players manage all aspects of its rise, from economic growth to political power, the development of armies, and expansion into other regions by war and diplomacy.
Empires are controlled from three main views: the Campaign Map shows the entire game world, including mountains, forests, coastlines, oceans, rivers, cites, and armies. The City Map gives players an overview of the structure and role of a city within the empire, and provides a basis for economic decisions. The Battle Map is to be used when diplomacy has run its course or when a city is being attacked, resulting in turn-based combat.
All nations, cities and armies were carefully researched to ensure historical accuracy. The game is accessible for new users, while offering deeper gameplay for expert players.
Game.Title: History Egypt: Engineering an Empire

Game.Notes: Exiled from a planet devastated by the Cosmic Sneeze, Spad, Bruce, Cosmo, Helmut and Monk embark on a quest to vanquish the evil Yagor, who, in turn, swore to hunt them down until he's witnessed their complete and total annihilation. Aboard the S-Pace, our five heroes must once again thwart Yagorâs diabolical plans. In a race against time, they have to defeat hordes of enemies and face mind-blowing dangers. Will they finally succeed in putting an end to Yagorâs despotic hold over the universe? Visit new planets, meet new creatures and play more mini-games as you guide our friends in their quest to save the cosmos.
Game.Title: Widget's Odyssey 2

Game.Notes:
The multiple award-winning puzzler is back in a new sticky form! Denki Blocks! is a puzzle game like no other. Slide sticky blocks around a board and join the same colours together to solve puzzles. BUT! There are two important twists that make this game so special:
1. All blocks not fixed or obstructed will slide.
2. Blocks of the same colour stick together when they touch.
Features
* Over 100 beautiful puzzles to enjoy, each hand-crafted for maximum pleasure. * Beat clever Master Challenges such as making shapes and besting move or time pars. * Complete over 100 Master Challenges to earn Denki Stars and open up secret puzzles. * Solve the puzzles to reveal the secrets of the island.
Game.Title: Denki Blocks!
Space Shooter for Two Bucks!, A

Game.Notes:
The Terminator for PSP is an explosive top-down all action shooter with an episodic Story Mode and endless Quick Play mode.
The player is Kyle Reese and the objective is to help him progress through several levels to access Skynet's core. Visually, the environment is virtually the sameâa desolated area full of wreckage and debris. In addition, an intense soundtrack is included as well as the weapons fire and explosion sound effects.
Game.Title: The Terminator

Game.Notes: DynoGems is an addictive and challenging puzzle game! Grab and group four or more diamonds of the same color to eliminate them from the screen, until you fill the level bar.
Game.Title: Dyno Gems

Game.Notes: Rasmus Klump is Saving the Chickens is a Edutainment/Miscellaneous/Puzzle video game published by Nordisk Film Games Publishing released on February 18, 2012 for the PlayStation Portable.
Game.Title: Rasmus Klump is saving the Chickens

Game.Notes: Chopper I is an 1988 arcade hall video game, developed by SNK. The objective of the top-down game is to infiltrate enemy territory and essentially destroy all objects. The game can be played with 1 or 2 players; both players, each occupying one helicopter, play simultaneously.
Game.Title: Chopper I

Game.Notes:
In 19th century Victorian England, an unknown serial killer brutally murdered five prostitutes between August 31st and November 9th of 1888 and was never caught by the police. He received the nickname of "Jack The Ripper" after the signature from a letter, that was supposedly written and sent by the gloating assassin to the Scotland Yard and printed in the newspapers of the time. Chief Constable Melville Macnaghten investigated the case and wrote a final report naming five suspects.
Real Crimes: Jack the Ripper is the second entry in a series of a hidden object games based on actual murder cases. As Macnaghten and the notorious forensic scientist Francis Galton, the player must search and click on all the items listed at left side of the screen, on locations related to the case and filled with assorted objects. Some of the items are clues about the murders, bringing up a window at the center of the screen with details about the object and its relation to the case. The hint button is a police badge below the list, that shows the position of one of the required items when activated. Police badges can be found and collected from the scenery for extra hints.
A few mini-games appear between locations, where the player has to complete a jigsaw puzzle with pieces of a shredded letter, a tile-sliding picture puzzle, a spot-the-differences game with two similar images, a memory game with matching tarot cards and other similar challenges. There are two modes: Detective Mode with a time limit of 10 minutes per scene, and a Rookie Mode without any time constraints. Extra seconds can be added to the timer by collecting the fingerprints pressed over the scenery.
Game.Title: Actual Crimes: Jack the Ripper

Game.Notes: While Richard, the true King of England, is absent from his throne, his country rages in chaos. England has been invaded, and enemies burn and destroy local towns and villages. After the house of expert archer and hunter Robin Hood was burned down, he, together with a group of free archers like himself, hides in Sherwood Forest and begins his fight for justice. The fate of the people now lies in your hands.
Game.Title: Robin Hood: The Return of Richard
Game.Version: Robin Hood - The Return of Richard

Game.Notes: Have you ever dreamed of walking on a magnificent world with the feeling that nothing can stop you because of your power, of what you are? You are the young and mighty god of thunder and the fate of the universe is in your hand. Yggdrasil, the world tree, is dying. The three Norns, Skuld, Urd and Verdandi are missing and no one is tending the world tree.
Game.Title: Young Thor

Game.Notes:
War of Sonria is a turn-based strategy game where you play the role as a battle commander.
Create your own band of hand-picked soldiers and fight through a plethora of immersive environments. Choose from a large roster of unique characters and battle it out against vicious A.I. Or compete against a friend in intense hotseat battles!
Superior strategies win the battle â make clever use of environments to gain bonus positional damage, or execute perfect abilities gain the upper hand.
Good luck!
Game.Title: War of Sonria

Game.ApplicationPath: ..\roms\pspminis\Dr. Maybee and the Adventures of Scarygirl.cso
Game.Notes: Based on the Scarygirl graphic novel created by acclaimed artist Nathan Jurevicius, Dr Maybee and the Adventures of Scarygirl is a marvelous adventure through the Scarygirl universe, as she attempts to discover the identity of the mysterious, bearded man haunting her dreams. With help from her friends, the quick-witted Bunniguru and Blister the giant octopus, she will journey from her treehouse home in the forest to an overwhelmingly unfriendly city in her quest to locate Dr Maybee. Features Surreal Art by Nathan Jurevicius: Scarygirl's fantastic landscape and creatures are both beautiful and bizarre to behold Scarygirl & Friends: Calling them a âcolorfulâ cast of characters would be an understatement. Scarygirl, the part-octopus girl who dresses like a pirate, has a tentacle for her right hand and has naught but a bone for her left, is the star here, though each friendly or treacherous creature she meets will certainly be unique It's a Completist's Paradise: In each level, players can search high and low for hundreds of gems, fish, and other items to collect.
Game.Title: Dr. Maybee and the Adventures of Scarygirl

Game.Notes: This version of Fighting Fantasy: Talisman of Death features a Tarot Card character generation system, and the classic dice-rolling rule set you know and love, with optional all-new Battle and Test Your Luck systems for bold adventurers to explore.
Game.Title: Fighting Fantasy: Talisman of Death

Game.Notes:
You'll want to drive JellyCar 2 all around town!
JellyCar 2, the hit driving platform game is here and fully loaded with more than 30 levels, three game modes, and much more! Post high scores, best times and longest jumps in the Hall of Fame. With so much squishy goodness, youâll want to drive JellyCar 2 all around town!
Classic: Drive your squishy car and use your special abilities to drive through squishy worlds!
Factory: Where does all this squishy goodness come from? The Jelly Factory, of course! In this puzzle game your goal is to guide the falling parts into matching chutes. Tap the levers to open different pathways to guide each part down the conveyor belts.
Long Jump: Youâre going for distance, so go for speed! Watch out for objects that can slow you down, and look for objects that can help give you a boost!
Game.Title: Jelly Car 2

Game.Notes:
One Epic Game is an Infinity Runner video game developed by Czech company Grip Games. The game was released in 2011 for PlayStation 3, PlayStation Vita, PlayStation Portable, IOS and Android. The game is parody for multiple video game and movie clichÃ©s.
The player controls an infinity running character. He can only jump or shoot. Jumping helps him avoid obstacles and traps while shooting kills enemies. Player can also kill enemies by jumping on their heads. There are multiple game modes in game. The main is story mode. There are missions with consistent story. There is a task in every mission (for example getting through 1000 metres, getting to finish with only one life or kill certain numbers of enemies). Every mission is set in one of five worlds - Zombie Outbreak, Nuclear Wasteland, World War II, Alien Invasion and Fantasy Kingdom. Story is told by comix scenes.
Another mode is Free Run. In this mode layer chooses a World and then tries to make the highest possible score.
The last mode is Challenges. Player chooses his task there and then he tries to fulfil it. He can also choose difficulty. For the lowest difficulty he gains bronze medal while for the hardest he gains gold medal.
There are multiple weapons in game. Player starts with Pistol. He can also take another weapon on his way, for example Shotgun, Machine gun, Rocket launcher, Flamethrower or Laser. Every weapon behaves differently. When a player is hurt he loses his gained weapon and has to fight with a pistol again. Player can always carry only one weapon. Player can also take Heart, that gives him life, or jetpack, that allows him to fly. There is a checkpoint at every 1000 metres.
Game.Title: One Epic Game

Game.Notes: Have you ever wondered what it would be like to be Cupid? In Love Cupid it is your job to help couples fall in love by shooting as many hearts as you can with your love arrows. Work together with a friend to collect the fallen hearts and increase the couple's affection by filling up their love meter. But be careful to avoid menaces in your way and corrupted bad hearts. Share the love!
Game.Title: Love Cupid

Game.Notes:
Welcome to Urbanixâa game inspired by classic computer games! You play as Urbanix, a tiny little tractor that has to build a town on an empty field. Avoid enemies and catch and chase away house crashersâthey will try to spoil your game. Play on Earth, in the North Pole, or on the moonâall locations have different gameplay mechanics, therefore you will have to adapt your strategy. Be accurate, be quick, collect bonuses on your way, and you will be the winner!
Features
â¢ Enhanced gameplay based on decades-old classics
â¢ Three different worlds that have different gameplay modes
â¢ 150 levels set across all worlds
â¢ Intense Multiplayer mode
Game.Title: Urbanix

Game.Notes: Puzzle game addiction meets doodle-style graphics! Your task is simple: fit the given sets of blocks into given shapes. Drag the blocks inside and outside in search for the layout that covers the whole shape. A level is complete when all blocks have been used and there's no more space free in the shape.
Game.Title: Doodle Fit

Game.Notes:
Oh no! The Space Program is in peril now there's NO MONEY ANYWHERE IN THE WORLD!! That won't stop two scientists from taking on the Orbit project, a no-budget exploration of our solar system.
Dodge through asteroid fields, and avoid nasty enemies intent on stealing cash, fuel, or just throwing slime in your eyes!
By collecting the money mysteriously floating in orbit around the planets, you'll give the project a cash boost, upgrading shonky systems and gaining new ships to move beyond the Moon - from Mercury to Uranus - as never before!
Orbit's research menu features almost 200 unique upgrades, plus there are hidden relics and blueprints to find, stat tracking, and 12 challenging medals to earn.
The launch pad is all set. Are you ready to get into Orbit?
Game.Title: Orbit

Game.Notes: On a mission to collect precious moon rocks, the adorable aliens, the Marbians, have crash landed in a dusty attic in New Mexico left untouched since the '40s. Now you must help them find their way back to their UFO and gather as many moon rocks as possible on your way. The Marbians is a fun physics-based puzzle adventure that offers 72 levels of tricky timing, peculiar precision and tremendous brain teasing for the whole family.
Game.Title: The Marbians

Game.Notes: Fort Commanderâ¢ is a twist on the classic tower defense genre set in the Mogul conquest period. You play the role of the commander of the Mogul army. You must defeat two opposing kingdoms - Malwa and Bengal - in a total of 14 missions including two Assault and two Survival. The game play is built around the strategy for expanding and controlling the Mogul empire. In Campaign mode, you defend your tower until the enemy population is depleted and then you conquer their tower. In Assault mode, you charge the enemy tower until you deplete their population. In Survival mode, you hold out for as long as possible against an ever increasing enemy force.
Game.Title: Fort Commander II: Counterattack

Game.Notes:
Here with Ronnie O'Sullivan's Snooker, you play through the highlights of Ronnie's career culminating in his most famous World Championship wins. Have you got what it takes to re-create his many stunning victories?
Ronnie guides you through the game, giving advice, even taking you back to his home table where you can refine your skills in his very own practice room.
Memory Stick Duoâ¢ Compatible: 2MB
Download of this product is subject to the Sony Entertainment Network Terms of Service/User Agreement and any specific additional conditions applying to this product. If you do not wish to accept these terms, do not download this product. See Terms of Service for more important information.
One time fee for use of downloads on up to 2 activated compatible Home Console systems and 3 activated compatible Portable Console systems. See Health Warnings for important health information before using this product.
Library programs Â©Sony Computer Entertainment Inc. exclusively licensed to Sony Computer Entertainment Europe. Software Usage Terms apply, See eu.playstation.com/legal for full usage rights.
Ronnie O'Sullivan and his name, likeness, image & biographical data have been used under license from Ronnie O'Sullivan. The use of the names or images of any other snooker players, events, organizations, tournaments or venues within this game are intended as factual biographical references only and this game is NOT endorsed by such third parties.
Game.Title: Ronnie O'Sullivan's Snooker

Game.Notes: Feisty Feet, is more of a traditional game with a slight twist. Itâs a take on the side-scrolling running game popularized by Canabalt. You control a little guy who runs toward the right side of the screen, leaping over obstacles and from platform to platform, most of which are at different heights. Instead of it being an infinite runner, theyâve changed the gameplay so itâs a race with other runners. Itâs not just a simple race, though; it reminds me more of a kart racer. You have special power-ups that give you a speed boost and make you jump. You can also pick up weapons, ranging from a simple snowball to a rocket launcher and some sort of tangle grenade that you drop behind you to stop an opposing runner briefly.
Game.Title: Feisty Feet

Game.Notes: BreakQuest is back and is twice the fun! Stunning visuals and shapes, energizing physics and exciting sounds! Enjoy 100 Ñompletely redesigned action-packed levels, each featuring own colorful design, elements behavior and visual effects. An advanced physics and collision system gives a never-seen-before experience for your pleasure. And donât forget about weapons and power-up bonuses as well as the amazing Gravitor which attracts the ball to you. Breaking bricks has never been so fun!
Game.Title: BreakQuest: Extra Evolution

Game.Notes: Stop the happy ending! Help Boss, your gigantic princess-eating monster, defeat the hordes of heroes, and show them who the boss really is in this action packed game.
Game.Title: Wackylands Boss

Game.Notes: Bubble Trubble is a dynamic new twist to falling puzzle games that lets players rotate and drop clusters of colored bubbles, matching colors to fuse them together and grow them until they burst. Be sure to combine matched colored bubbles together before running out of room. To avoid any trubble, you've gotta burst your Bubble! Three zany cartoon animal guides react to players performances as they present each level and its unique environment's challenge. Be sure to watch out for the Power Bubbles that may enhance or impede your performance.
Game.Title: Bubble Trubble

Game.Notes:
Your objective is to control a laser beam towards its destination. In each level you are given a laser source and its destination. You need to redirect the laser beam from its source to destination using objects like mirrors and prisms. But beware! There are valuable objects in the way, you must work around those objects and not let the laser touch them, else they will explode and you start afresh on that level.
Every level poses a different difficulty, where you have been given a particular budget to buy objects. You must finish within the given budget and find your way through different obstacles that lay in between the laser and its destination.
There are 90 unique levels with 3 different difficulty modes to test your puzzle skills to deflect the laser to its destination
Game.Title: Deflector

Game.Notes:
In this entry in the popular tower defense genre, players aim to eliminate the Vectoid threat before they reach the end of the path. You do this by constructing towers along the path to attack oncoming Vectoids. Success is not based solely on the types of tower you select, but where you place them and what upgrade and bonus options you take.
At your disposal are eleven flavors of towers, each of which can be upgraded to level 10 (increasing the towerâs damage and range). The Green Lasers, for example, lock onto one Vectoid and deal ongoing damage. The Red Spammer fires heat-seeking rockets at random targets in range. Blue Ray towers drain power and cause Vectoids to slow down. The in-game guide lists each tower in detail. Every few waves youâll also be rewarded with a Yellow Energy Cell, which you can use to purchase one of three Boosts. Damage and Range Booster towers can be placed on a grid to increase the stats of other towers around it.
Vector TD for PSP features eight maps (two Beginner, three Normal, three Extreme) as well as all eleven tower and seven enemy types of the original Flash version. Exclusive to the minis version is a brand-new control interface â youâll be able to select each griâ using the D-pad or analog stick and place/upgrade towers.
Game.Title: Vector TD

Game.Notes:
Are you the MENA Speed champion? Customize and upgrade your car then accept challenges across different terrains. MENA Speed is the first drag race game with tracks in major cities across the Middle East, pumping up your adrenaline with screeching tires and burned rubber across the roads of Dubai, Amman, Kuwait and Cairo.
Enjoy the different power-ups by upgrading your car engine, gearbox, cooling system, and manifold to improve your carâs performance; and customize its look with different paint jobs, spoilers and rims; all with a wide range of options.
Game.Title: MENA Speed

Game.Notes:
Freekscape: Escape from Hell is a 2.5D puzzle platformer. The protagonist is the horned demon Freek who is left behind in hell because he does not enjoy torturing souls. That is why he is tasked with housekeeping chores instead by his master Beel. Working alone, he discovers the key to the treasure room, steals a trident and attempts to escape hell to reach heaven. To complete levels the exit needs to be reached. Levels are accessed one by one on a large world map and they branch out at a certain point with multiple paths.
Puzzles are based on platforming and using the abilities of different creatures. Freek can use his trident to skewer other minions, carry them around or use them as a pogo stick to jump higher. One type of creature rushes and can knock Freek over large gaps. Another type acts as a trampoline. Creatures can sometimes be dropped into the lava to create safe passages. A hug block rushes to hug you. By taking it out up to three can be skewered to use them as a bridge. Creatures are summoned through portals at specific locations. Freek can also draw their attention by whistling. Freek has his own portals that act as checkpoints when he passes them. Some levels require you to locate a number of peppers to unlock a pepper portal before a level can be finished. The D-pad can be used to look around while the analog stick control movement.
Game.Title: Freekscape: Escape From Hell

Game.Notes:
Play crossword puzzles from the 'Telegraph' like you've never played them before!
Discover a whopping 500 puzzles of multiple types. You're in for many hours of gameplay!
With its handy interface and intuitive controls, this game transfigures the classic pen-and-paper experience.
Notable features include:
â¢ A huge selection of quick puzzles, cryptic puzzles and general knowledge puzzles!â¢ Registration of best times in the Hall of Fame.â¢ Interactive hints prevent you from being stuck!â¢ Auto-save as you go: you can stop and resume a puzzle at any time!
Game.Title: Telegraph Crosswords

Game.Notes: Welcome to Hello Flowerz, the gardening game where you have fun with flowers. Sow your favorite flowers and look after them every day, helping them grow into healthy, beautiful flowers. Use your flowers to create wonderful bouquets and enter them in regular competitions. Landscape your own gardens, transplant flowers and arrange various items. Put on your gloves, grab your tools and start showing off your flowers!
Game.Title: Hello Flowerz

Game.Notes: Achieve total Bloon popping satisfaction with BloonsÂ® TD. This really is classic TD at its best. With a multitude of towers and weapons at your disposal can you pop all of the bloons before they escape? Battle your way through 50 challenging levels and 8 exciting tracks as your army of monkeys defend the never ending wave of bloons. Upgrade towers and traps to defeat the enemy and earn the gold medals to become the TD master!
Game.Title: Bloons TD

Game.Notes: Jump and roll with Pallurikio, a fast-paced action platformer, easy to pick up, yet challenging to master. While playing a mysterious board game he found with his friends, Rusty is sucked up in a dimensional vortex and finds himself cast into a mystical and wondrous world, where he assumes the aspect of the round and bouncing Pallurikio. Make Pallurikio jump and roll, and help him find his way through more than 50 enticing levels, while surviving all kinds of pitfalls and trickeries he might come across when traversing Bakumbala Jungle, the far reaches of Palluro Prime and many other environments. Featuring physics simulation, Time Attack mode, collectable cards, and space rockets, Pallurikio is a game on which you wonât want to miss out!
Game.Title: Pallurikio

Game.Notes: Puzzle Scape is a block busting game where the player arranges same colored blocks to 2x2 formations to explode them. All adjacent same colored blocks will also explode in a chain reaction. The player can move the blocks by swapping two adjacent blocks horizontally. There are several power-ups to aid the player. The game modes include two single player modes and several multiplayer modes including a co-op mode.
Game.Title: Puzzle Scape

Game.Notes:
Phase Shift follows the story of Xargis, a genius programmer fighting against cyber terrorism in the future.
Defeat your enemies and protect The Network!
Visually represented as a âShip Battleâ, Phase Shift presents a unique 2D Arcade Shooter game with a warp mechanic, providing a vibrant and dynamic game-play.
Game.Title: Phase Shift: Threats Beyond the Network

Game.Notes:
You are an elite pilot of a small blimp who will have the future of an entire planet on his shoulders. Blimp: The Flying Adventures is larger-than-life journey that will take you across a savage planet.
Lush jungles, snowy mountains, scorched deserts and dusty rocks in twenty beautiful, hand-drawn, danger-filled levels will test your skills; flying a blimp is an experience like nothing you have played before!
Defend strategic targets, transport soldiers, collect supplies and decimate the enemy fleet. The future of your homeworld is yours to write! And when you are done with the main campaign, try the more challenging difficulty levels, find all the hidden treasures and upload your high score to global Leaderboards to see if you are the best blimp pilot in the known universe!
The adventure is taking off! Are you brave enough to join?
Game.Title: Blimp: The Flying Adventures

Game.Notes: With authentic darts playing feel, prepare for fun as you control your throws precisely and easily with. Challenge over 20 different computer opponents with a range of playing skills or play against a friend.
Game.Title: Arcade Darts

Game.Notes:
Are you smarter than the average bear? Help Polar solve all 50 brain-freezing puzzle levels. Use snow, ice, metal and dynamite blocks to crack these conundrums. Achieve the Move and Time targets for each puzzle and collect all 150 Gold Stars.
Over 20 hours of gameplay* spanning the Icy Wastes, across The Frozen Sea, through The Twilight Forest to the Edge of the World and on to the Oil Rig.
Game.Title: Arctic Adventures: Polar's Puzzles

Game.Notes:
Bee Wars is a hybrid of turn based strategy and resource management. Your objective is to control a group of bees having different skills and collect more honey than the enemies in a given level, but beware! Opponent bees will attack your workers and thief bees will steal honey from your hive. You must either opt to eliminate all of them or outmatch them by collecting more honey till all the moves run out.
Strategize, by securing your worker bees from the opponent ninja bees and collected honey from the opponent thief bees. At the same time you can also counter with your own thief and ninja bees to cripple their collection and gain advantage.
Highlights: â¢ 80 unlock-able levels with progressive difficulty â¢ 4 controllable species of bees, each possessing different skills and abilities â¢ Player promotion feature: For achieving certain conditions players are awarded with medals of honor and are promoted to higher levels
Game.Title: Bee Wars

Game.Notes: In the unique world of Funkyville, a musical power called the Funky Flow has empowered some with amazing abilities. But Klyde has evil plans afoot and has built an army of Emoticons to do his bidding and control the flow for himself.
Game.Title: Funky Punch

Game.Notes:
The Impossible Game. With a title like that, you know itâll be a tough rideâ¦ but "The Impossible Game" takes difficulty to a whole new level. Itâs fast-paced and brutal, but with near-instant respawning, the experience is as smooth as it is deadly.
You play a humble orange square, racing against a serene blue background. The trick is that there are plenty of obstacles on this course: triangles are like deadly spikes, and squares can be jumped on top of but will kill you if you slam into them. Likewise, you can die if you fall through a hole in the floor. Your orange square will hurtle forward regardless of the danger, and your only control is simp: tap to jump. Longer taps equal longer jumps, and youâll need meticulous precision if you want to survive. The music syncs with your music, which is a very nifty effect that adds to the surreal quality of the whole thing.
Most of the time, youâll only survive for a few seconds. The Impossible Game is unforgiving. Every time you die, the counter at the top of the screen takes note and then sends you straight back to the beginning. Most of the time itâs a constant cycle of death and rebirth, and youâll quickly rack up hundreds of deaths. Thereâs only one level, but good luck finishing!
The Impossible Game would be truly impossible if not for Practice Mode. Tap the white flag, and it will materialize in the level where your block currently is. This places you in Practice Modeâwhen you die, you get sent back to the flag instead of the very beginning. This lets you get lots of practice with a specific sequence, so you might actually be able to win.
Game.Title: The Impossible Game

Game.Notes: Enigmo is a unique 3D puzzle game where you manipulate slides, bumpers, and other pieces to control streams of flowing liquid. Liquids (water, oil, and lava) fall from "droppers" and will bounce around the walls of a puzzle. You move and rotate the various puzzle pieces in order to divert the flow of the falling droplets so that they can reach their target. The faster you complete each level, the more bonus you will receive, the higher position in high scores table you get.
Game.Title: Enigmo

Game.Notes:
Championship Manager 2010 Express gives players total control on the move as you manage your favourite teams from around the UK, France and Italy anytime, anywhere. Packed with all the player data, club information and more from the 2009/10 season.
Pick from across multiple UK, French and Italian leagues and begin the journey to managerial success.
â¢ Individual Player Training âHone player skills and prepare them ahead of the big games. â¢ 2D Match Engine â See how your team is dealing with the opposition and be ready to tweak your tactics on the fly, or make key substitutions if things arenât going your way. â¢ Full promotion & relegation â With full relegation and promotion across the leagues managers could quickly find themselves heading to non-league football & the sack if they fail to perform. â¢ Press Conferences - Face the full glare of the media with post match press conferences and be ready to explain your on pitch actions to the waiting press.
Game.Title: Championship Manager 2010 Express

Game.Notes: Boom Beats is an addictive rhythm game which lets you enter compelling worlds full of club tunes: drum and bass, jungle, dub step, rave and house. All you need to do is tap the rhythm and earn score. Use multipliers, unlocks, special powers and more. Headphones recommended.
Game.Title: Boom Beats

Game.Notes:
Welcome to Jewel Keepers: Easter Island â an addictive match-three arcade action game with mind-blowing visuals and engaging storyline! This game will keep you entertained for hours, as you travel across Easter Island and help to unveil its mysteries.
More fun from Nordcurrent: - 101-in-1 Games â a collection of 101 games in one app. Frequent chart topper in USA, UK, Australia, and many other countries! - Urbanix â an enhanced version of Xonix and Qix, with new modes of play, new worlds and enemies! - Robin Hood: Return of Richard â help Robin to defeat the villains and restore peace in this action game!
Game.Title: Jewel Keepers: Easter Island

Game.Notes: So you thought you were the âproâ of arcade games? Swot up on your classics! 6 shapes of 4 blocks that drop without ever stopping, lines to complete and make vanish, 3 levels of difficulty, static blocks to hinder your progress and gradually increasing speed... Thereâs nothing like a bit of quick thinking to get rid of the stress!
Game.Title: Tetraminos

Game.Notes: The gameplay involves guiding a cube around 48 levels collecting coloured prisms, taking care not to fall off the paths. The player can make the cube climb over steps. By balancing the cube along the edge of a wall or space, players can hang across certain edges in order to cross large gaps.
Game.Title: Edge

Game.Notes:
Play the classic mine sweeper game as youâve never played it before! Hive sweeper offers unlimited number of the classic game set in the unique atmosphere of a hive. Be careful! Crazy graphics, chilling music, will soon make you a number one addict to Hive Sweeper.
What is more!!! Have you ever got bored of playing minesweeper alone? Now with Hive Sweeper it is no longer possible! MULTIPLAYER mode offers you the chance to play wirelessly over Bluetooth or you can always play online if you have wifi or internet connection. Invite your friend or find an opponent via Game Center. Anyway, get ready for the ultimate battle!
Test your brain power, smartness and patience in the 3 types of game style each coming with different cell shapes. Find your challenge! In addition to the classic square board you may choose hexagon or triangle grid as well. What is more each board type comes with 15 difficulty levels. You are the one who can set the parameters. Decide the size of your board and the number of mines! This way you can start with easy boards or really-really hard ones if you like. Adjust the time and challenge yourself. Or you need a bit more practice? Then set the unlimited time mode!
Collect your hive points to unlock all the features of the game. The more you play with the game the more hive points you get. Not patient enough? You get the chance to earn FREE hive points really easily! Not content with this? You may buy hive points for a very small amount if you wish.
Now for a limited time with 99 Hive Points for free! (Internet connection required.)
Are you an absolute beginner? Or an expert already? Hive sweeper is the mine sweeper for you!
FEATURES: -unique atmosphere, graphics and chilling music -retina display support -3 types of board: triangle, hexagon, square -3 board sizes in each board type: small, medium, large -you can set the time of your game or choose unlimited time-mode -you can set the number of mines -number of remaining mines and time display during game -constantly breakable time record -easy to control: zoom in-and-out with multitouch and scroll with one finger -single tap to clear a spot, long tap to mark a flag -smooth and fast gameplay: tap a clear spot with no surrounding mines and neighbours open automatically -first touch guaranteed not to hit a mine -listen to your favourite music while playing with Hive Sweeper -Open feint supported leaderboard and challenging achievements
MULTIPLAYER options: -play over Bluetooth or Game Center -adjustable types of board, number of mines and time -if your game ends you may ask for revenge
Game.Title: Hive Sweeper

Game.Notes:
Zenonia is an action role-playing game created, developed, and published by Gamevil for iOS, Android, PlayStation Portable, Nintendo DSi, Zeebo and Windows Mobile. It was released on the App Store on May 24, 2009 and on the Google Play Store on March 27, 2010. It was released for the PlayStation Portable on October 12, 2010.
The main character, Regret, is controlled through use of an on-screen d-pad, which is located in the lower left corner of the screen. There are many side quests that the player can choose to complete in order to further explore the world. The main storyline can be changed by the player depending on whether they decide to make certain choices that will cause their character's alignment to shift more quickly towards good or evil. There are four classes in which the player can choose from: Paladin, Warrior, or Assassin, each having a unique fighting style. The game also features hundreds of different weapons, and a full class skill tree for each of the classes. Gamevil claims that Zenonia has 40 hours of gameplay.
Regret's in-game appearance changes based upon his equipped weapon and armor set.
Game.Title: Zenonia

Game.Notes:
Los Angeles is under siege from gangs roaming in vehicles. They attack ordinary citizens mercilessly. The cityâs Mayor appoints you the City Police Chief. Your brief is to eliminate the thugs and regain control of your city. You will direct and control the forces at your disposal to outwit the enemy. Your mission is to direct car chases in hot pursuit of the criminals using all resources available to you.
Car chases across the streets of Los Angeles! Place police vehicles on the roads of L.A. in order to hunt down the thugs before they escape. Zoom in to watch car chases unfold along the famous streets of L.A.
An action game of strategy and car chases with: â¢ 4 Famous L.A. locations! â¢ 8 Levels of play! â¢ 17 Cars & bikes to play with! â¢ 60+ Waves of thugs to defeat! â¢ 100s of exploding vehicles!
Game.Title: L.A. Gridlock

Game.Notes:
Play number-puzzles from the 'Telegraph' like you've never played them before! Discover a whopping 500 puzzles of multiple types. You're in for many hours of game play!
â¢ Sudoku: Classic 9x9 Sudoku grids in 4 levels of difficulty. â¢ Mini-Sudoku: Easier 6x6 grids. â¢ Sudoku-X: 9x9 grids in which the diagonals must also be filled with all numbers from 1 to 9. â¢ Jigsaw Sudoku: 9x9 grids with uncommon box shapes. â¢ Kakuro: With its handy interface and intuitive controls, this game transfigures the classic pen-and-paper experience.
Game.Title: Telegraph Sudoku & Kakuro

Game.Notes:
Journalist Nicole Rankvist receives a letter from Robert, her archaeologist father, describing the discovery of the key for a powerful artifact called the Crystal Portal. When he goes missing, Nicole must find the scattered pieces of the key around the world.
The Mystery of the Crystal Portal is a hidden object that replaces the traditional list of objects names with a different gameplay mechanic. The player has to click on certain objects in the scenery that open a circle around it with photographs of items that must be found and dragged to it. After picking all the required stuff, some of these container objects disappear to reveal a key item underneath them.
Some of the objects have to be collected in one screen to be used in another place (for example, finding matches outside the house to light a fireplace inside). At the end of each stage/location there's a unique logic puzzle game to be solved, involving some of the objects that the player picked up.
Game.Title: The Mystery of the Crystal Portal

Game.Notes: Days of Thunder invites gamers to enter the high-pressure world of stock car racing in this adrenaline-packed multiplayer arcade title, putting gamers up against the film's lead characters, including Cole Trickle, Rowdy Burns and Russ Wheeler.
Game.Title: Days of Thunder

Game.Notes:
Alert! Alert! OMG-Z! The City of Redfield has been hit by an outbreak of exploding zombies! For cool and unimportant reasons these suckers literally explode when shot, showering their zombie brethren with gore and causing chain reactions of showering zombie gibs with just a single bullet! Armed with this knowledge (and bullets coated in a zombie-exploding pathogen) your elite unit is dispatched to the epicentre of the outbreak. Your mission? Succeed where the police and army failed and clean up the city!
For reasons that aren't important right now, all but one of your team is killed before arriving at the outbreak's epicentre, leaving YOU to deal with thousands of zombies ALONE. Use your chain reaction skills to explore 81 waves of zombie hell across 32 environments. Earn 324 shiny medals and cold hard cash, and use it to buy 70 different upgrades all designed to MAKE ZOMBIES EXPLODE!
Game.Title: OMG-Z
